page.title: 19A FRENCHMANS TIME AT W'BORO
page.content: When you are appointed French assistant in an English school,you can't help thinking about all those preconceived ideas foreigners have about the English way of life. As far as I am concerned,I have really enjoyed the atmosphere at Wellingborough school.First I grew used to the quietness and simplicity of the school-life and quickly under_ stood that here,tradition remains the keyword whatever you do.Then I found out that English cooking is far much better than expected.Fortunately,the importance of games is such that a regular training session prevented me from putting on too much weight.I also learnt to appreciate the British sense of humour:special but interesting.I wonder whether I shall find it easy to readjust to the French way of life. The states are so close,yet so dif'rnt
